projects.description: Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button.

Displaying a large amount of data on a web page, like a list of 200 movie titles or 400 products, can overwhelm a user with too much information at once. A common solution is to create separate “pages” that each display a small portion of the data.
Full Stack JavaScript developers create forms to collect information from users for nearly every website and application they build.

Browser-based, word guessing game: 'Phrase Hunter'. A player tries to guess the phrase by selecting individual letters from an onscreen keyboard. Can they guess the phrase before they run out of attempts?

Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that you can access and display on your own web pages. Using JavaScript, I created an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API (Application Programming Interface).
